slides.title: Indian Penal Code (IPC) Basics
slides.content:
**IPC 1860:** Main criminal code

**Common Sections:**
- 302: Murder
- 304: Culpable homicide
- 307: Attempt to murder
- 376: Rape
- 420: Cheating
- 498A: Domestic violence

**FIR:** First Information Report (starts investigation)

slides.title: Criminal Procedure (CrPC)
slides.content:
**CrPC 1973:** Procedure for criminal law

**Key Sections:**
- Section 41: When police can arrest
- Section 154: FIR registration
- Section 161: Police questioning
- Section 167: Remand

**Types of Offenses:**
- Cognizable (police can arrest without warrant)
- Non-cognizable (need warrant)

slides.title: Important Acts & Rights
slides.content:
**Key Acts:**
- SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act
- POCSO Act (Child protection)
- Domestic Violence Act
- Arms Act
- NDPS Act (Narcotics)

**Rights:**
- Right to know charges
- Right to lawyer
- No custodial torture
- Bail provisions

question.explanation: FIR stands for First Information Report - the first step in criminal investigation when a cognizable offense is reported.
